incidents.name: Issues passing Challenge Pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Challenge Platform

incident_updates.body: This issue only affected a small subset of visitors that landed on Custom Error Pages created by Cloudflare customers that contained additional meta tag with name="referrer" and content="never" attributes. Removing this meta tag from your Custom Error Pages solves this problem.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Challenge Platform

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare has identified an issue where some visitors may experience issues passing Challenge Pages.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Challenge Platform

components.name: Challenge Platform
components.description: When a website is protected by Cloudflare, there are several occasions when it will challenge visitor traffic. If the visitor passes the challenge, their request is allowed. If they fail, the request will be blocked.

incidents.name: Waiting Room Queue issues

incident_updates.body: Between 2023-08-30 22:12 UTC to 2023-08-31 17:16 UTC, Waiting Room queued some users while far under configured limits on low traffic sites

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard and Cloudflare API service issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard and related APIs.
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

incidents.name: Analytics Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare Analytics processing is running behind. This affects timely delivery of customer data.

These delays will impact R2, Pages, Turnstile, Analytics Engine, and Waiting room.

incidents.name: Cache Purging Delays in China

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - CDN Cache Purge

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - CDN Cache Purge

incident_updates.body: Additionally, we've uncovered there are underlying Network issues causing this behavior, declared in a separate incident.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - CDN Cache Purge

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare single-file cache purging (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API is experiencing delays in China locations.

We are working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. Until then you may use the Purge Everything feature but do be aware it may cause a surge in traffic to your origin server(s). More updates to follow.

incidents.name: Intermittent error rates affecting cache, waf, workers and pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to recover. Additional impact: Customers pushing new Cloudflare Pages deployments may experience rate-limiting failures.
System continues to be stable, and we are monitoring recovery.  No further impact is expected at this time.
System continues to be stable, and we are monitoring recovery.  No further impact is expected at this time.
System is stable, we are still monitoring recovery
We are nearing full recovery and will continue to monitor
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We have experienced an increase in intermittent error rates affecting cache, WAF and Workers returning a 500 error when adding or modify an object/setting. The root cause has been identified and a fix is in place. We are monitoring closely. The majority of impact ended around 1:47 UTC. Areas of impact included AMS, HKG and LIS.
